place.name: LITTLE DUNHAM
place.gazetteerText: DUNHAM (Little), a parish in Mitford distrlct, Norfolk; on the East Anglian railway, at Dunham station, 4¼ miles ENE of Swaffham. It has a post office under Swaffham. Acres, 1,835. Real property, £3, 227. Pop., 327. Houses, 69. The property is divided among a few. Dunham Lodge is the seat of George Copeman, Esq. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Norfolk. Value, £451.* Patron, the Rev. J. Nelson. The church was restored in 1862. There are a Primitive Methodist chapel, a national school, and charities £75. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
